This script cleans up the NA values from pseudomonas

```{r read staphylococcus}
library(tidyr)
summary(x)
good<-complete.cases(x)
pseudo<-x[good,]
summary(pseudo)
pseudo
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
good<-complete.cases(x)
pseudo<-x[good,]
counter<-c(pseudo['carb'][])
library(tidyverse)
#pseudo$carb[pseudo$carb==TRUE])
#hhist(pseudo$carb[pseudo$carb==FALSE])
```
```{r}
library(tidyr)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)

good<-complete.cases(x)
pseudo<-x[good,]
```


```{r}
ggplot(data = pseudo, aes(x=carb, y = as.numeric(carb), fill = LabID, width=0.5))+stat_summary(fun.y = sum, geom = "bar", fill="#FF9999")
ggplot(data = pseudo, aes(x=toby, y = as.numeric(toby), fill = LabID, width=0.5))+stat_summary(fun.y = sum, geom = "bar",fill="yellow")

```
